properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:51AM CST until January 14 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
A Dam Break in...
North central Oktibbeha County in northeastern Mississippi...
South central Clay County in northeastern Mississippi...

* Until 245 PM CST.

* At 1147 AM CST, emergency management reported the imminent failure
of Oktibbeha County Lake Dam. The dam has not failed yet but there
is a high probabilty of failure.

THIS IS A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR NORTHERN OKITBBEHA COUNTY AND
SOUTH CENTRAL CLAY COUNTY. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!

HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from the imminent failure
of Oktibbeha County Lake Dam.

SOURCE...Emergency management.

IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER
GROUND NOW! IMMEDIATE EVACUATION for areas downstream
from the Oktibbeha County Lake Dam along the Biba Wila
Creek and Trim Cane Creek.
properties.instruction:
Move to higher ground now. This is an extremely dangerous and
life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are
fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR OKTIBBEHA COUNTY LAKE DAM
CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 2:45 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
